questions.text: A 23-year-old male lost his job due to the covid pandemic around 2 months ago and ever since is unable to concentrate, he feels sad and incompetent and is finding it difficult to overcome his low mood and feelings of worthlessness. According to DSM-5 criteria, the patient was identified as having Major Depressive disorder. The DSM-5 criteria are published by:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

American Psychiatry Society DSM-5 diagnostic criteria are published by the American Psychiatry Society . WHO gives the International Classification of Diseases (ICD).

questions.text: The alphanumeric code for the disorder shown in the image according to ICD 10 is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

F40 – F48 The image shows cynophobia, unexplained fear of dogs . It is studied under F40 of ICD-10 .

Highyeild:

ICD 10 has a total of 21 chapters. All psychiatric disorders have code F. F00 - F09 - Organic Mental Disorders F10 - F19 - Mental and behavioral abnormalities due to substance abuse F20 - F29 - Schizophrenia, SchizotypF29and Delusional disorders F30 - F39 - Mood disorders F40 - F48 - Neurotic, stress-related, and somatoform disorders F50 - F59 - Sexual, eating, and sleep disorders F60 - F69 - Disorders of adult personality F70 - F79 - Mental retardation F80 - F89 - Disorders of psychological development F90 - F98 - Behavioural and emotional disturbances with onset occurring in childhood or adolescence

questions.text: A 26-year-old male was brought to the emergency with a history of increased heart rate, sweating, uneasiness, and difficulty in breathing. On enquiry, the attendants gave the history of consumption of products shown in the image. On examination, P-110bpm, BP-130/90mmHg, RR-17/min, afebrile, saturation 96%. Chest examination normal. ECG showed tachycardia. The given case is classified under which chapter of ICD-10:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

F10- F19 The given clinical scenario points towards intoxication symptoms of cannabis It belongs to mental and behavioral abnormalities due to substance abuse discussed in F10 - F19 .

Highyeild:

ICD 10 has a total of 21 chapters. All psychiatric disorders have code F. F00 - F09 - Organic Mental Disorders F10 - F19 - Mental and behavioral abnormalities due to substance abuse F20 - F29 - Schizophrenia, Schizotyp F29, and Delusional disorders F30 - F39 - Mood disorders F40 - F48 - Neurotic, stress-related, and somatoform disorders F50 - F59 - Sexual, eating, and sleep disorders F60 - F69 - Disorders of adult personality F70 - F79 - Mental retardation F80 - F89 - Disorders of psychological development F90 - F98 - Behavioural and emotional disturbances with onset occurring in childhood or adolescence

questions.text: A 25-year-old male who is on treatment for the mania phase of bipolar disorder comes for a follow-up and is taking his medication regularly. The mood variation of the patient throughout the disease is as shown below. The patient belongs to which alphanumeric code according to ICD 10:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

F30 - F39 The given clinical scenario and image are that of bipolar mood disorder . Mood disorders are classified under F30 - F39 of ICD-10.

Highyeild:

ICD 10 has a total of 21 chapters . All psychiatric disorders have code F . F00 - F09 - Organic Mental Disorders F10 - F19 - Mental and behavioral abnormalities due to substance abuse F20 - F29 - Schizophrenia, Schizotypal, and Delusional disorders F30 - F39 - Mood disorders

questions.text: A 22-year-old female was brought by her mother with complaints of persistent low mood, decreased sleep, and intake of food and crying for almost 4-5 months. It started when she started scoring low on all her tests. On questioning the patient says she isn’t worthy of all the care and is good for nothing. The disability status of the patient is assessed by IDEAS which includes:- Self-care Work Language and communication Interpersonal activity Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

All the above The given clinical scenario points towards a case of depressive mood disorder . The Indian Disability Evaluation And Assessment Scale ( IDEAS) includes the following domains for the assessment of disability in psychiatry patients:- Self-care Work Language and communication Interpersonal activity

Highyeild:

It is applied only in presence of informants . Symptom status in the last 2 years is analyzed . Benchmark disability is 40%.

questions.text: A 20-year-old female is brought by her mother for behavioral counseling. Her mother is a nurse at a warzone and cannot take the girl with her. So she has made arrangements for her daughter to stay in a hostel until she gets transferred there. On further history taking she was known to have a dependent personality disorder. The criteria to classify under this category according to DSM-5 is /are: Needs others to assume responsibility for major areas of life. Goes to excessive lengths to attain nurturance and support from others Has difficulty making everyday decisions. Urgently seeks another relationship as a source of care or support. Is unrealistically preoccupied with the fear of being left to take care of self. Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 2, 3, 4, 5 A dependent personality disorder is a pervasive pattern of dependent and submissive behavior . Persons with the disorder cannot make decisions without significant and unwarranted advice and encouragement from others. Symptoms/Criteria Include: Fears separation, and needs others to care for them. Cannot make decisions alone Avoids taking on responsibility for important things Cannot disagree with others for fear they will disapprove of them Lacks confidence, cannot initiate new things Seeks acceptance from others Fears of being alone/independence When the relationship ends, quickly seeks a new one Fears of having to take care of self

questions.text: A 32-year-old male came to the psychiatry OPD as he wanted to quit drinking alcohol. The psychiatrist wanted to analyze the dependence of the person and questioned him according to RAPS4 criteria. Which of the following questions isn’t included in the questionnaire?

options.label: A
options.text: Have people annoyed you by criticizing your drinking?

options.label: B
options.text: Have you ever felt guilty after drinking?

options.label: C
options.text: You failed to do what was normally expected after drinking?

options.label: D
options.text: Have you had a morning drink?

questions.correct_answer: A. Have people annoyed you by criticizing your drinking?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Have people annoyed you by criticizing your drinking? The question in option a) is asked as a part of the CAGE questionnaire . Some psychiatrists use a brief standardized questionnaire, the CAGE or RAPS4 , to identify alcohol abuse or dependence.

Highyeild:

CAGE includes four questions: Have you ever C ut down on your drinking? Have people A nnoyed you by criticizing your drinking? Have you ever felt bad or G uilty about your drinking? Have you ever had a drink the first thing in the morning, as an E ye-opener, to steady your nerves or get rid of a hangover? The Rapid Alcohol Problem Screen 4 (RAPS4) also consists of four questions: Have you ever felt guilty after drinking ( R emorse)? Could not remember things said or done after drinking ( A mnesia) Failed to do what was normally expected after drinking ( P erform) Had a morning Drink( S tarter)?
